qas.question: In what time period did GE pollute the Hudson River with PCBs?
Who founded the Hudson River Sloop Clearwater and the Clearwater Festival to bring attention to the pollution caused by GE?
What designation did the EPA give to the site of GE's Hudson River pollution
What other types of pollution have contaminated the Hudson River watershed?
In what year did Pete Seeger found the Hudson River Sloop Clearwater?
In what year did the EPA designate GE's plant on the Hudson River as a superfund site?
In what year was musician Peter Singer born?
In what year did GE start polluting the Hudson River with mercury?
In what year did sewage dumping in the Hudson River become a problem?

context: General Electric heavily contaminated the Hudson River with <a2_0>polychlorinated biphenyls<a2_0/> (PCBs) between <a0_0><b5_0><b6_0><b7_0><b8_0><b9_0>1947<b9_0/><b8_0/><b7_0/><b6_0/><b5_0/>-77<a0_0/>. This pollution caused a range of harmful effects to wildlife and people who eat fish from the river or drink the water. In response to this contamination, activists protested in various ways. Musician <a1_0>Pete Seeger<a1_0/> founded the Hudson River Sloop Clearwater and the Clearwater Festival to draw attention to the problem. The activism led to the site being designated by the EPA as one of the <a3_0>superfund<a3_0/> sites requiring extensive cleanup. Other sources of pollution, including <a4_0>mercury contamination and sewage dumping<a4_0/>, have also contributed to problems in the Hudson River watershed.
